meanings.definition: Consisting of or relating to two things
meanings.sent1: The binal stars in the sky shone brightly together.
meanings.sent2: The binal doors of the house opened simultaneously.
meanings.sent3: The binal cookies on the plate looked like a perfect match.
meanings.sent4: Their binal friendship was as strong as two peas in a pod.
meanings.sent5: The binal colors of the flag stood out against the blue sky.

meanings.sent1: The binal of socks was neatly folded in the drawer.
meanings.sent2: The binal of birds chirped harmoniously in the tree.
meanings.sent3: The binal of shoes by the door seemed to dance together.
meanings.sent4: She and her best friend were a binal that everyone admired.
meanings.sent5: The binal of keys jingled as he walked down the hallway.

meanings.sent1: The computer program used a binal code to operate.
meanings.sent2: In the binal system, numbers are represented using only 0s and 1s.
meanings.sent3: The binal digits seemed to have a secret language of their own.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a binal machine, processing information quickly.
meanings.sent5: The binal language of computers fascinated the students in the class.
